3: I don't understand why you're so eager to test out that command system...
You don't understand its true value.
I get it. It's necessary for us to have a training mechanism for commandants on standby, but it doesn't have to be 'this' one.
Our understanding and awareness of 'war' are weak. Even for those at F.O.S.
They only wish to train a commandant's 'commanding skills,' not 'military skills.'
Most importantly, with the current team structure, the commandant's long-term partnership with Constructs creates an unnecessary emotional attachment between them.
Well, isn't that a good thing? Trust between each other allows them to execute missions more effectively.
Yes, it is a benefit. But it's also a recipe for disaster.
Do you remember the tragedy that befell the Suzaku squad? That's the result of unnecessary emotions between a commandant and Constructs.
However, the security and functionality of the system must be confirmed before we can formally discuss the matter.
Of course. We found the most reliable commandant to test it.
After Hassen leaves, Nikola begins talking to himself as if speaking to someone.
Looks like even they don't realize the terrifying force of a commandant whose fate is interlaced with multiple powerful Constructs.
They could even overthrow Babylonia if they so choose to.
Indeed... This idea may not have taken root yet, but it must be nipped in the bud.
